body: We are seeing this issue on API 23 and below across all devices. Serious issue with this library, is there a better fix?
@CCorrado Can you try with 2.2.1. There are a number of changes in 2.2.1 related to the way progress is handled.

Yes, we're compiling Lottie 2.2.1. 

To start the animation, we're running this: (Our animator is dependent on a Timer, which is where the totalStateSeconds variable is updated/initialized)

```
(LottieAnimationView) view;
view.setSpeed((BigDecimal.valueOf(SECONDS_IN_MINUTE_FLOAT)
        .divide(BigDecimal.valueOf(totalStateSeconds), 
                MathContext.DECIMAL128)).floatValue());
view.setProgress(totalStateSeconds);
view.playAnimation();
```

and noticing that when we run:

`(LottieAnimationView) view.pauseAnimation`

The Animation restarts and plays from 0 on APIs 23 and below instead of pausing in its current state. We've tested on emulators running 23, 22, and 19, and tested on a Samsung Galaxy S4 running API 21 (5.0.1). 

Our XML looks like this:

```
<com.airbnb.lottie.LottieAnimationView
            android:id="@+id/animation_view"
            android:layout_width="match_parent"
            android:layout_height="match_parent"
            android:layout_gravity="center"
            android:layout_margin="10dp"
            android:background="@android:color/transparent"
            android:gravity="center"
            app:lottie_autoPlay="false"
            app:lottie_fileName="json_data/animation.json"
            app:lottie_loop="false"/>
```

To resume the animation after being in a paused state, we run this:

`if (!view.isAnimating()) {
            view.resumeAnimation();
        }`

I've tried playing with the different APIs, but this current setup works on API 24 and above. Not sure what could be causing it.
I think this will fix your issue @CCorrado. It fixes some logic as well as the pre-23 issues you experienced. I tested this down to API 16.
Nice. I'll review it in a bit. Had a feeling something was off internally, Android APIs are such a pain. +1 for Kotlin
@CCorrado I wish I could write the Lottie library itself in it :(

@gpeal is there a snapshot of 2.2.2 with those changes you made? The workaround start/pause/resume is pretty unreliable, although it significantly reduced the amount of times the issue occurs it still sometimes does happen. Just curious, we can wait for 2.2.2 to be released before compiling it
I have the same issue on a Google Pixel 3, the animation restart itself with onResume
